docs.title: man cspp
docs.text:
Welcome to CS++'s manual!

This is where all of our public operations documents are kept.

IN DEV

These docs are HIGHLY unfinished.

docs.title: Contributing to man
docs.text:
man, or manpage is CS++'s operational docs.

These docs focus on the non-technical area of CS++ and covers everything from role definitions, tasks, events and other procedures we might need to successfully run the society.

This wiki is maintained through a Git repository that can be found here ⧉, and is best edited through Obsidian ⧉.

docs.title: Cloning the Repo
docs.text:
First, clone the repo. For this you will need git installed and configures

Bash
git clone github.com/cs-soc-tudublin/man.git

Then open Obsidian and set man/docs as your vault directory! Setting it to just man will include more files than you need, but will still work.

docs.title: Modifying a Page
docs.text: Find the page you want, and modify it. Once that it done, use CTRL + P or CMD + P to open the 'Command Palette' and search for Git: Commit-and-Sync. Once this is selected, press ENTER and it will automatically send your changes up to GitHub which will automatically deploy them after about 2 minutes!

docs.title: Creating a Page
docs.text:
This is the most common task outside of modifying pages.

Find the directory you want to put the new page in, right click it and press New Note. This will create the file and it's title will become the filename.

Once you've done that, press CTRL + P or CMD + P (depending on OS) to open the 'Command Palette' and search 'docs'. You should see an option that says Clerk: Create a docs page. Press ENTER while this is highlighted and you will get a pop-up.

Enter the Page title (Which is displayed on the website) and any tags (Like the category this page is in. I.e. handover), then click 'Submit'. This will create the relevant Properties that are needed to properly display the page.

Once you have finished creating your page, follow the same procedure found in Modifying a Page above.

docs.title: EVENTS @ CS++
docs.text: This section will cover how to plan for events, as well as dedicated pages on our annual events.

docs.title: HANDOVER @ CS++
docs.text:
On the 1st of July every year, all roles officially handover to whoever was elected in the AGM. If a role wasn't filled, this role instead becomes vacant.

This section contains our handover docs, as well as how to plan a successful handover.

docs.title: HISTORY @ CS++
docs.text: This section will covers the history of CS++. So any relevant details for each year, as well as the committee.

docs.title: ROLES @ CS++
docs.text:
This section covers all roles within CS++.

There are three 'groups' of roles in CS++:

  1. The Core Committee
    1. Chairperson
    2. Vice Chair
    3. Treasurer
    4. Secretary
    5. Health & Safety Officer
    6. Public Relations Officer
  2. The General Committee
    1. Technical Events Officer
    2. Social Events Officer
    3. Second Year Rep
    4. First Year Rep
    5. Events Rep
  3. The Systems Administrators
    1. 5x Systems Administrators

docs.title: Required Roles
docs.text:
CS++ is REQUIRED by TU Dublin to have the following 6 roles:

  • Chairperson
  • Treasurer
  • Secretary
  • Health & Safety Officer
  • Public Relations Officer
  • First Year Rep

docs.title: Elections
docs.text: The first 5 mandatory roles (Chair - PRO) are usually elected in an AGM at the end of an academic year, with the First Year Rep being elected early in Semeter 1 the following year

docs.title: TASKS @ CS++
docs.text: This section will cover all common tasks that are done by committee members on the society. Everything from booking rooms, to filling out budgets, etc.
